document.masterDocTitle: A sea of worms: polychaete checklist of the Adriatic Sea

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A sea of worms: polychaete checklist of the Adriatic Sea

subSubSection.paragraph: DISTRIBUTION : NA , CA, SA.

LITERATURE
RECORDS
:
Barnich & Fiege 2001
, 2003 ; Mikac et al . 2011 .
NEW
RECORDS
: BM 11 , BM 12 , BM 13 , BM 18 , BM 19 , BM 20 , BM 21 , BM 22 , BM 27 , BM 28 , BM 33 , BM 34 , BM 38 , BM 39 , BM 40 , BM 45 , BM 46 , BM 47 , BM 48 , BM 49 , BM 50 , BM 51 , BM 52 , BM 53 , BM 54 , BM 65 , BM 66 , BM 74 , BM 92 , BM 99 .

REMARKS : The Mediterranean records of the species need to be checked due to the confusion with
Malmgreniella lunulata (Delle Chiaje, 1830 ) (
Barnich & Fiege 2001
)
.
DISTRIBUTION : NA , CA.

OTHER
REPORTED NAMES
:
Malmgrenia castanea McIntosh, 1876
;
Harmothoe castanea (McIntosh, 1876 )
. REMARKS :
Barnich & Fiege ( 2003 )
reported the distribution of
M. castanea
for the Western Mediterranean and Northeast Atlantic, but noticed that all the other records needed to be checked, due to its similarity with
M. lunulata (Delle Chiaje, 1830 )
and
M. andreapolis (McIntosh, 1874 )
.

bibRefCitation.author: Pettibone

(1993) Scaled polychaetes (Polynoidae) associated with ophiuroids and other invertebrates and review of species referred to Malmgrenia McIntosh and replaced by Malmgreniella Hartman, with description of new taxa. Smithsonian Contributions to Zoology, 538, 1 - 92.

OTHER
REPORTED NAMES
:
Harmothoe lunulata (Delle Chiaje, 1830 )
.

REMARKS : Since
M. lunulata
has been often confused with other related species (
M. darbouxi
Pettibone 1993
,
M. andreapolis (McIntosh, 1874 )
and
M. castanea (McIntosh, 1976 ))
all the literature records from the Mediterranean Sea and Northeastern Atlantic are doubtful and need to be checked (
Barnich & Fiege 2001
).
